intro: Drosanthe scabra, commonly known as the rough drosanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Drosanthe scabra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
